data.title: Great downtown location
data.text: It is good to see a grocery store downtown Pontiac.  High end groceries.  The price is a little more than Krogers, or Walmart but the change is good.  The meat selection is awesome.  Great soups.  Small but a great addition to downtown.

data.title: Great food at a reasonable cost !
data.text: This is the best place to go for a quick but delicious sandwich.  I really enjoy the Swiss Portobello melt on ciabatta bread. It melts in your mouth.  The service is fast and friendly.

data.title: Making downtown Pontiac great again !
data.text:
I came for the food, not the groceries. The groceries and wines were nicely displayed and and looked very appealing. 
This is an excellent place to get a sandwich. There is a lot to choose from and not the same stuff that you see everywhere. I ordered one of the veggie sandwiches containing different cheeses (melted) roasted red peppers, portabella mushrooms, and caramelized onions - all on ciabatta bread.  It was absolutely delicious.   
Since this is a self serve restaurant, there is nothing to comment on with regard to the service, except for the friendly face that took my order and my money.

data.title: Healthy, delicious food oasis in Downtown Pontiac
data.text:
Located in the old Sears department store building, the Lafayette Market is part grocery store, part cafe. It has a gorgeous selection of fresh foods, meats (butcher on site), local favorites, Michigan-made products, craft beers, wines, etc. It is more expensive than your average grocery store, and I wouldn't want to have to feed my family of five from there every day, but it is a beautiful store and we often splurge on some unusual fare. 

The cafe serves fresh, healthy soups, salads, and sandwiches as well as breakfast selections. My favorite thing happens during the summer on Friday "Patio" nights. Weather permitting, the huge glass doors on the side of the building are opened up and there is live music, a full bar, and delicious dinner selections all while dining al fresco on the patio. (In case of inclement weather, the party moves inside) The crowd is always diverse and friendly. So nice to see some activity again in this once-bustling city. It is a family favorite for my guys.

Lafayette Market also offers catering and banquet space. 

Try it, you won't be disappointed!!!
